caption: You can't go wrong with a bialy from Kosar's.  Always delicious!
Fresh Bagels, everytime, Kossar Sandwich...so good
Messed up my order. Whole wheat bagel is decent, nothing special, the chicken salad is too mayonnaisey, and the cream cheese they messed up so overall meh. There’s better in the city in general.
These are the worst New York City bagels I have had in a long time. Avoid this place at all costs. Pretty much any other bagel place in the city will have much, much better bagels.
They make the best bagels here and the services is one of a kind. Everyone that works here are as amazing too.
Excellent bagels excellent coffee excellent service
Delicious, classic bagel shop. Pumpernickel was my favourite.

I just received 2 dz bialys from Kossars and have to say it was so disappointing!  The bialys are: cakey and puffed up; too dense and floury; lacked onions of any consequence in the center; flavorless; and not even as good as the ones sold at Wegmans grocery store.  To ship them at $72 for 2 dz is a disgrace. I would want to return them for a refund. I was offered $15 against some other purchase in the future instead of returning these but when I said to just credit it against this purchase, they refused! I realized that customer satisfaction didn’t matter to Goldbelly, just their outrageous pricing and lack of customer care!  I’ll never buy anything through them again.
So good that it's life changing. Much better than most kosher bakeries in NYC.
My favorite rugelach and bagels on the entire island

We get  challah bread and bagels and cream cheese from here a lot. The challah bread is the best in town. However, some days the bread doesn’t seem to be as fresh as others. Overall a great place to order breakfast.
This place is a timeless classic. Have been coming here all my life and the new owners/management really fixed the place up nicely. A bit pricey but worth it!!
(Translated by Google) Excellent 👌  (Original) Excelente 👌
Great 🌷and great delicious bialys🍩🍪🍤🍞🥢
(Translated by Google) Terrible the service they do not know how to attend and they are very slow  (Original) Malísimo el servicio no saben atender y son muy lentos
Really chewy bagels!  Great flavours~
Kossar's has the best bagels not only on the Lower East Side of Manhattan but in New York City❕ This place been here for years & is very well known. They always have fresh made bagels.🥯🌆🌇🏙🌁🗽
Does not indicate anywhere online that their hours have changed to 3 PM. Arrived at 3PM, but staff didn't pick up calls or open the door, just ignored me. Took my money, but received no food.

If you want a cheap bagel or bialy, this is not your place. But if you want to sink your teeth in the best bialys ever, get a Kossar's bialy hot &  fresh out of the oven. No fish or spread needed. Just time it right. And enjoy! But if you need some fish, they have it too. Though Russ & Daughter's is a couple of minute drive away.

I placed an order yesterday (Christmas Day) via seamless. I was so happy they were opened, and looking forward to having the family try this place out. However, when the food finally arrived it was not complete. I ordered three bacon, egg, and cheese platters with different bagels. The platters included home fries. None of my orders had home fries instead they all had three slices of tomato’s. I called in as soon as I opened my order. The gentleman that answered the phone stated they had called me to inform me they were out of home fries. I took a look at my phone log and they had not reached out to me at all. Therefore, they had just lied to me, which is even more disappointing. I informed them I shouldn’t have to pay full price for a platters, which weren’t  complete. I also informed them I was missing a platter since it did not arrive with the correct bagel. I ordered a platter with an everything bagel. I received a platter with a plain bagel. The gentleman apologized and asked “What would I like and he would send it?”. I told him my correct platter, and a challah bread loaf for the inconvenience. He states it was not an issue, and he would be sending it out now. However, it never arrived, and worst he never called to inform me he would not be sending the order. Additionally, on seamless my total was $96. 76 with an applied $5.00 promo. Although, the paper receipt the total was 100.67. They did not honor the applied $5.00 promo on seamless for spending more than $60.00 dollars.   Yes, the actual taste of the meals we did receive was great; however, would of been nicer to have received my complete orders. I did report the issue to seamless, and at least they will refund me since this place did not.
Used to be good, new owner ran it into the ground
The use week old bagels for twice the price. Avoid.

They always try to give me the bad bagels even when i say can you get that one. The register lady overcharged and i told her and she changed it but didnt say why it was over? I hope this place closes indefinitely.

To me this is the best bialy spot. There's is no substitute for a fresh hot bialy with herb cream cheese. It also is the only place you can get freshly baked bukas and onion rings.  I remember getting this before they remolded the same store  back in the 90's .When I worked the area from 2200hrs to 0700hrs. You could get freshly baked bialy at 5AM. Sad to say after the modernization. It's just not same store anymore. Gone are the small onion rings,  gone are the big and small bulkas with onions on top. The smell and aromas are gone. Every thing is enclosed. The Bialy's have gotten smaller. I wasn't even tempted to eat one while leaving the store. .

Does Kossar's even need a review?! Kossar's has been around for like 200 years! Actually maybe not 200 but I hear that it's like 100 years. The lines here are always long especially in the morning. As soon as you enter you can see their chefs baking fresh goods through their see-through kitchen. Bagels, bialys, sandwiches, lox, tasty coffee, list goes on. Love it!
I was so excited to find Kossar's on Goldbelly and ordered a dozen bialys.  You just can't find good ones here in Arizona.  I'm so disappointed that the onion bialys I ordered came with no onions!
Very mediocre bagel and the staff takes forever to prepare the foods. There are much better options around

The current place is nowhere near the quality of the original. This place is more for tourists, your basic no frills bagel,/cream/lox. It's ok, just average. I don't like their non-basic things. The white fish salad is more like "whipped fish cream", maybe you like but not me .In the original place you couldn't help eating one before stepping outside the door, the smell and taste was incredible. Went today and they were frying up a big batch of smelly bacon, far from authentic. The people working there are helpful but this place needs to be better managed .Would be a good Gordon Ramsey video.
My wife and I order breakfast here 2-3 times a week and we love it. Great quality and customer service through and through.
Best bacon egg and cheese bagel in the city.
Too slow enough personal work but lazy
Never heard of bially until I visited this place on a food tour, would highly recommend a visit.
(Translated by Google) Very good very good attention.  (Original) Buenísima muy buena atención.
Excellent service and selection
Delicious food and great service!
Best bagels in NYC by far. Always fresh and their staff is really friendly! A must every time I come to NYC.
Yummy food and great clean store!
The best bagels and bialys in NYC!
Really the best place in New York City for classic bialys. Went during Covid and it was a smooth operation for pickup.

Having tried a lot of bagel places in the LES this one is our favourite. Bagels are a great size - it has the perfect combo of crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside. The everything seasoning is also very generous.

Ever wonder what the old NYC smelled like, felt like?  It's still here.  Right before your eyes are huge sacks of flour plus the XL ovens where they make bagels and bialys, HOT and d-lish.  Kossar's also features something called the pletzel - halfway between a giant street pretzel and an onion bagel.  Who knew?  Can't get enough of them.  Slightly pricey, but a find!
Bagels are fantastic. Tried a turkey, egg, and scallion cream cheese on a everything bagel, so fresh and crispy and delicious. On the pricier side but super close if you live in the LES.
Great NYC Bagels, Croissants and 1/2# of Egg & Chicken Salads.

Atmosphere/layout *Small shop, few tables, small counter space  Service *Quick  Food/drink *Ordered the Essex St on a plain bagel (salmon pastrami, avocado and dill cream cheese) and an onion bialy - both very good

Used to be less expensive. Also, I waited forever to get my bagel. Not sure why, I ordered a single sandwhich and I waited at least 20 minutes. They are disorganized and are not making orders in the order they are recieved.

Discovered this place as I walked by, the display is good I wish they would add tags to the baskets to make the decision making process easier. I ordered the garlic bialy with cream cheese and got the sesame bagel to go. The bialy was great but the bagel was one of the best and freshest I ever had. Incredible! The line wasn’t organized because everyone was just trying to stand on the side while they read the menu on the wall. Simple tags would’ve help so much. Not enough seating but that’s not a deal breaker for me.
amazing service. it was busy when i went in but they made sure someone served me straight away. i love the jumbo black and white cookie. what a great place.
That babka tho
(Translated by Google) Raisin Bagel + Cream Cheese Very good. A lot of cream cheese and good price :-)  (Original) 건포도베이글+크림치즈 너무 맛있음. 크림치즈 양도 많고, 가격도 착함:-)
Delicious bagels, you can watch them being made in the kitchen while you wait for your order. The cream cheese and salmon combo was great, also want to try other fillings next time.
Total clown show. 1/4 chance they will even deliver your food.
I just saw this joint on “$9.99”...I’ve got to go.  If you want a lot of onion in your bialy center, go to Kossar’s...you’ll get it in spades!
service was wonderful and the food was great
Go to bagel spot in the neighborhood! Line usually goes out the door, but service is quick. Order is usually made right, but there have been a few times where we've waited 15+ minutes for our bagels.
Delicious bagels, plenty of full dish options. Staff are helpful, friendly, true customer care. They made our breakfast a great NYC experience. -thank you Aron.
Great bagels! Good service and efficient order process, so the wait was not too long even though it was very busy.
So good. Got an egg and cheese bagel and it’s real real eggs grilled up right there no fast food microwave eggs
(Translated by Google) Bought a garlic flavor Very energetic 1.5 yuan  (Original) 買了一個大蒜口味 很有ㄐㄧㄠˇ勁 1.5元
Great food, only downside is sometimes you have to wait a little while but overall great place
First time in New York and ordered a sesame seed bagel with cream cheese, tomato and bacon! Incredible!!! They even deliver to your hotel room! Will definitely be ordering again!
Only pejorative is they are overwhelmed by their deserved popularity, that said, food and service is spot on.

(Translated by Google) Really a real recommendation, super tasty and fresh bagels. The service is really great.  (Original) Wirklich eine echte Empfehlung, super leckere und frische Bagel. Auch der Service ist echt top.

They will prioritize takeout/seamless orders before those waiting in line. If there is even one person in line, be prepared for a 1.5 hour wait. Russ and Daughters is down the street and is faster with service.
A neighborhood staple.  Real bagels.  Heavy. Chewy.  The way God intended.  The place is mobbed in the mornings on weekends.  The best places are
Trust and believe. This is THE bagel place. This is where you’ll take visitors who want a New York bagel. Sweet (jelly and cream cheese) or Savory (pastrami lox) - it’s all great.
Incredible bagels went every morning during our stay

Ordered and paid for two sandwiches and after thirteen minutes waiting asked where they were. Was told to “settle down”. A number of customers after me had been served, one with a similar order. Had to leave without sandwiches that I paid for. Never returning and I had been a frequent customer for the last 5 years, except for when they refurbished.

I get two bagels nearly every morning through Seamless, but I had to stop ordering from Kossar’s because:  1) they never put napkins, utensils, or straws in the bag 2) they’re 45 min average delivery time when all the other bagel places (even ess-a-bagel on 22nd) are 25 minutes average 3) the bagels have lost the chewiness they once had and get hard quicker 4) the large iced coffee is only 16 oz, but priced like a 32oz  I seriously suggest they improve the service for seamless customers.  They’re the 4th best bagel place in the area.  But if they can have quicker service and keep things fresh then they might get some of my orders again.
Delicious fresh bagels....

UPDATE to my review:  I decided to go back a week after the visit described below and ordered a lox sandwich.  The two countermen from my prior visit were not there; instead the regular guys I am used to were behind the counter.  They filled my order and when it came time to pay, the young cashier, who was witness to my distress last time I was there, apologized to me and offered me my sandwich free of charge.  It was a very gracious and thoughtful gesture on her part.  Bottom line: I have been patronizing Kossar’s for many years and they have the best bagels, bialys and lox to be found anywhere.   My upsetting experience notwithstanding, they are a great place to go to for authentic LES cuisine. —————————————————  I am a long time resident of the Lower East Side and have been coming to Kossar’s pretty much all my life.  The food is wonderful; you name it: bagels, bialys, lox, all consistently delicious.  And the staff has been terrific, cordial and pleasant.  That is, until today.  My wife and I stopped in for breakfast and I ordered two bagels, one with scallion cream cheese and lox and the other with vegetable cream cheese and lox.  We got our order, and left with our bag of bagels and coffee and embarked on the 10 minute walk home.  When we got home and I sat down to enjoy my bagel with cream cheese and lox, I discovered to my chagrin that the guy who filled my order has given me cream cheese but no lox.  My wife’s sandwich was similarly sans lox.  We both have busy schedules and simply didn’t have time to make the trek back to Kossar’s to exchange the sandwiches.   So we both ate our bagels with cream cheese.  Btw, I did find my receipt and it was clearly marked: “Nova lox: $19.50”.  So we clearly had paid for lox but didn’t get any.  I went back to Kossar’s about an hour later on my way to the subway and explained to the young lady behind the counter.  She has always been very pleasant and was pleasant this time as well.  While she was looking up my order, however, one of the two guys filling orders (not the one who had taken my order) asked me, dismissively and in a very belligerent tone, “So why didn’t you come back and return it right away?”.  He then proceeded to make other comments and we argued back and forth.  Then the guy who actually filled my order started chining in and continued the argument.  I was heated myself and argued back, stunned that they simply didn’t offer an “I’m sorry”; that’s all they had to say and I would have been fine.  Meanwhile the lady at the cash register couldn’t find my order (in my haste I had forgotten to come back with my receipt).  I got so fed up that I said the hell with it and just left without receiving a refund.  The irony is that I am moving away from the area and so wouldn't be coming to Kossar’s much anymore anyway, but now I’m absolutely never going back.  Again, it’s very sad to cut ties with a lace that I have loved coming to all of my life.  But the totally disgusting lack of any respect is something I cannot tolerate

Breakfast is calling!  The Classic Bagel from Kossar's Bialys are the best I've had in the city.  From the moment you walk in, you can tell the bagels are going to be bomb. It's an old fashioned place and you can't help but love it.  You know you're going to get a delicious bagel from a spot like this!
This is THE place for bagels and bialys.
Bagel is over toasted that my tooth hurt.
So a rude Latin woman took my money and told me to stand on the side while I waited 8 mins for coffee.

I ordered through grubhub and Left msg to call  call or leave at reception.. so after put on hold on phone for 20 mins for not getting my food after waiting over an hour for actual food. They replied we called and driver was there for 20 mins.. lol how abt I said leave at reception... so I just  lost 21 usd with tips with no food and no refund 👏👏👏
Literally nobody inside and not once did anyone behind the counter asked me for my order. I walked out.
(Translated by Google) Turkish ham cheese bagel is delicious. A lot of people. Strawberry cream cheese was just me  (Original) 터키햄 치즈들어간 베이글 맛있어요. 양이 많은편. 딸기크림치즈는 그냥저냥이었네요
Try finding a better everything bagel somewhere else in the city. You won't!

Pros: - decent bagel for $1.35 - add-ons are super expensive, they offer $15 bagel sandwiches and it doesn't come with truffles/caviar/gold flakes.  Cons: - screw up orders 9/10 times so check before you leave to make sure you get what you paid for - for a $6 bagel I expect more 1 thin smear of cream cheese
Pumpernickel Everything Bagel is great!

Worst service ever. Went in on Tuesday 8/27, placed an order for 12 everything bagels to be ready and picked up Wednesday 8/28 by 10 am. I have a flight to go see family and these bagels are for my sister. 11am rolls around and they still don’t know when the bagels will be ready. The bagels in which I went in a day in advance specifically to avoid this, guy who took my order on Tuesday said this was the best way, weren’t ready for an entire hour after they were supposed to be. Unacceptable, will never go here again, and I advise no one else ever give this place your business. Just not good enough to deal with the complete and utter garbage that is their staff.

Consistently better bagels.  Look at any dictionary for the definition of bagel, and the page should mention Kossar's Bagels.  Fresh, chewy yet soft, fluffy and yet somehow delicate, these bagels have everything you want in The Best NYC Bagel.  Try a plain, which has a faint marshmallow aroma when freshly opened, with some of their creamy cream cheese.  Any bagel fresh from the back comes warm, which only heightens the goodness you shall receive.  My wife let out guttural moans while eating the bialy; they reminded us of our youth and we both agreed we have never had better.  Share this comfort food gift only with your closest friends.
username: in the world to change it

caption: The food here is delicious. There is nothing like a hot bagel for breakfast from this place. They are fast and efficient and the people who work here are kind as well. It’s very busy in the weekends especially, so to still be able to have smiles on their faces with lines out the door sometimes is always a refreshing thing.

Good food if they get it right but they don’t have a good system for taking orders and mess mine up all the time. I have a severe dairy allergy and told them my order of tofu cream cheese (dairy free)on a bagel three times. When I got home, I ate half the bagel before getting extremely sick (they had given me normal cream cheese) and vomiting for over two hours. I can’t believe they can get away with this despite me asking them clearly so many times. Be careful there, especially if you have allergies or dietary restrictions!! My worst nightmare!!
Delicious!
One of my favorite bagel places in the city. They have a delicious simple egg and cheddar sandwich.

Very dissapointing. The bagel tasted (to me) like an enstein brothers bagel - no real chew or contrast between the crust and the middle. The bialy was a bit better, but still not worth seeking out and lacked onion flavor. There are many much better bagel options in the city.
My first NY bagle experience!  Not bad!  Good fast service!

Good bagels overall. I've found service to be lackluster. They're slow and they ignore you after ordering. I've come 6 times so far and they've messed something up 3 times (forgot to make the bagel, forgot a bagel, forgot cream cheese). Getting someone to even talk to you after paying is almost impossible. That being said, the fact that I keep coming back despite all these problems says something about the quality of the bagels.
Really great very happy
Delicious bagel and friendly service
Hot Bialys.... Great Sandwiches.... AWESOME SERVICE!!!!

This is my all time favorite spot for bagels and bialys. The classic is straight up amazing - all ingredients are fresh, and they don’t skimp on any ingredients. If you’re anywhere near East Village, I strongly urge you try their food!

(Translated by Google) Good Bagel! We've tested : - 1 bagel Cream cheese with salmon - 1 bagel cream cheese with smoked salmon Very nice staff :)  (Original) Bons Bagel ! Nous avons testé : - 1 bagel Cream cheese au saumon - 1 bagel cream cheese avec saumon fumé Personnel très sympa :)

Dense. Chewy. Real bagels, not the insubstantial small things they’ve morphed into when mass-manufactured— or when the owners and bakers have lost the true ‘bagels we used to have before we came to America’... recipes. Yesssss... the good, right bagels!
After seeing Kossar’s on a number of “best bagel” lists I expected to be let down but boy was I wrong. This place was fantastic, the food, the atmosphere, the staff. Amazing bagels!
They have the best breakfast and chicken noodle soup.

It was pouring rain but that didn’t stop us from piling in to this sweet bakery for some of the city’s best bagels, bialys, and cream cheese. If you like onion, have the double onion cream cheese - with both scallion and red onion. It’s super good. Bialys are a specialty here. If you know what they are, you know what I mean. Kossar’s is the definitive spot for them.  HIGHLY RECOMMENDED 🌟
Bagels worth the extra mile!!!
Amazing bagel sandwiches!
Stopped in early this morning for a sesame bagel with butter  $2.67 this price is excessive for what was a so so bagel with a dab of butter.

Probably the most NYC bagel spot in the city. Great bagels. Good sandwiches. The best cream cheeses. Nice staff. Some seats. When you're done hop next door to the pickle shop. Then hit Chinatown and Little Italy. Great start to any New York day.

Found this place on our last trip to NYC. We had them delivered daily, used Grubhub. They are amazing and to die for. Best bagels I've ever tasted. Sandwiches are also amazing. Kossar's has never let us down and you are alway full. Been here a few times now. Always great bagels and bagel sandwiches.
Very good bagels👍
(Translated by Google) Bagel bread cream cheese is delicious Nova salmon is not much.  (Original) 베이글 빵 크림 치즈 는 맛있음 노바 연어는 별로 ㅠㅠ

Not sure what's going on with the hechsher these days at this store there are very conflicting reports going around and it's sad to see that they are open on shabbos whether they have a heter or not or they worked some way around it, one thing is certain its forsure not in the spirit of shabbos

The only bagel shop in lower east side that opens before 7am. This shop has a great selection of bagels and spreads. They also have muffins. Decent selection of coffees and great selection of hot teas. This place is small with a total of maybe 10 seats but most people grab their food to go and I have never had a problem finding a spot and enjoy my breakfast there.
Great bagel in an old school basic cafe with subway tiles...
They lay the cream cheese very thick!
(Translated by Google) Good bagels. It's worth it  (Original) Gute Bagels. Lohnt sich

You have not had a bialy until you've experienced Kossar's Bagel and Bialys. Make sure you get the pickles down the block and also stop into the Donut Planet on the same block. Do not count on parking easily in the area but definitely part of the Lower East Side experience! Not far from the indoor Essex Market and the Tenement Museum.
These bagels are so good, just having butter on them is fantastic enough. I wouldn't want anything else to detract from the deliciousness of the bagel itself.
Great food but a bit hit or miss. The service is classic New York. It's fast, so I can't complain!

Worth it when the line is long, I normally get a LEO. Definitely try a bialy while you're there, they claim most people don't know what one is, I certainly didn't. Love being able to look back into the show where they make the bagels and bialys.
Yummy bagel sandwiches.  Fabulous selection of cream cheeses, pastries
Worst customer experience
Ordered an everything bagel with veggie cream cheese, the bagel was crispy on the outside and soft on the inside, and just the right amount of cream cheese.😋😋😋💞💕

I am a long-time customer, not a tourist. The bialys have changed. They are no longer tasty or oniony. The consistency is more like fluffy, slightly  baked white bread. For a better idea of what a bialy should taste like, go to Russ & Daughters.
Bialys fresh from the oven at a great price from a great Baker. Excellent experience all around
Had a great time here. Got Loks, Bialy, and a raisin cinnamon bagel. They're hot, crispy, and soft all at once.

A delicious bagel shop that upped the measure of a good bagel! Got a basic cream cheese and butter bagel and it was an amazing breakfast! Ton of character with lively and positive employees. Will be back!
The bagel and cream cheese were both awesome. I got the Kossar's classic. Only wish the bagel had thicker slices of salmon. Definitely worth checking out.
Really good ingredients and good recipes, not so expensive but quality/price really high
Fresh delicious bagels, hot soups, some original cream cheese spreads, and more.... make for a nice, satisfying, quick meal. Seating for 12 ? is sufficient unless a larger group arrives all at once.

(Translated by Google) Buy rocks cream cheese bagels. Cream cheese flavored with finely chopped salmon was sandwiched between solid bagels. It was delicious and filled with a single stomach. I was asked which bagels to choose from among about 10 kinds, whether to toast or not. Because it was a takeout, cut it in half, wrapped in oil paper and aluminum foil, and put it in a paper bag.  (Original) ロックスクリームチーズのベーグルを購入。 もちもちしっかりしたベーグルの間に、細かく切ったサーモン入りで味のついたクリームチーズが挟んでありました。 美味しくて、一個でお腹いっぱいになりました。 10種類くらいの中からどのベーグルにするか、トーストするかどうかも聞かれました。 テイクアウトなので、半分に切って、油紙とアルミホイルで包んで、紙袋に入れてくれました。
Excellent bialys n bagels, best in town! Limited seating.

come here for the bialys & stay for "dat schmear" of cream cheese.  Kossar’s—the iconic bialy, bagel, & more eatery— anchored on the Lowe East Side. Kossar's has bright clean interior old school interior with a small amount of seating. menu is posted on the wall. glass display has the cream cheeses available as well as lox. refrigerated unit has a variety of soft drinks. there's tea & coffee options as well. there are some breakfast/y sandwich options as well like bacon-egg-&-cheeses, egg sandwiches, & such.  the toasted bialy with a heap of cream cheese is my go to. warm carby fatty smooth creamy gluttony. the bagels are fine but the bialy is where it's at--it reminds of any finely baked Jewish bready roll. so freaking good.  the prices on some eats here seem a tad high but this is a some-times indulgence for me so it's no big deal.  the staff? pleasant and fast.  drops mic cuz i be all about the bialy
LEO...ORDER THE LEO

I was so excited to eat here but everything went wrong. People who came after us got their food, ate and were leaving and still nothing. They kept insisting the food was coming and eventually handed us a bag of food with the wrong order. It wasn't complicated - I ordered an everything bagel with cream cheese, somehow that turned into poppy seed with nothing but butter. I also had to ask multiple times just to get a glass of water.  The food was fine once we got it, but the service was definitely lacking.
The bialy is like a bagel but even better and the cream cheese was prefect. And not as expensive as in other bagel stores.

(Translated by Google) Well this place is one of the best in the area, here you can buy the warm bagels And the Bialys, also have more than 15 flavors of cream cheese, and white fish and baked salmon, and good dishes, sandwiches, juices sodas has tables to eat there ... and the atmosphere is nice as well as the employees that attend you very well ... I recommend them they will not regret if they visit it !!  (Original) Bueno este lugar es uno de los mejores del área, aquí puedes comprar los bagels calentitos Y los Bialys,,además tienen más de 15 sabores de cream cheese ,,y el white fish y el salmón baked , y bueno platos ,sandwiches,sodas jugos además tiene mesas para comer ahí..y el ambiente es agradable asi como como también los empleados q te atienden muy bien..se  los recomiendo no se arrepentirán si lo visitan !!

Kossar's is my favorite bagel shop in the Lower east side. I always get the everything bagel with tuna or chicken salad. They always have freshly baked bagels and challah. They have different choices for your bagel filling. Definitely go to Kossars if you want a bagel. It's a little pricey but so worth it and filling.

My wife and I were visiting NYC and had to have a bagel. Kossar's was on a top 10 list I found. Great food and service. Everyone behind the counter was friendly even with it being crazy busy. The bagels are huge and the price isn't bad at all. Especially for the amount of toppings
Bagels HOT and FRESH! Loved the strawberry cream cheese with it!
A GREAT bagel place. Inexpensive and soooo good!
Never actually been...just saw the place on Billions.  Was wondering if its actually a real place.    Pretty awesome being on such a great show.
This place got better. I never saw any babkas, ruglachs, and black and white cookies 10 years ago. I should visit more often.

Went before visiting the Tenement Museum and had a delicious egg, cheese, and bacon on an onion bagel. Coffee is delicious. I've had many an egg and cheese bagel but none like this. They chop up the bacon too which added a great texture to the sandwich. Loved it. Definitely go if you're in the neighborhood (even if you aren't...make a trip!)
This place has great bagels, however the service is very slow - especially compared to other bagel spots in NYC. Even without a line it will take 15 mins to get a bagel.
Best pumpernickel bagels I've had in a long time.

I have been coming here for over 30 years. I've seen the ups and the downs, the business has changed hands many times. The reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because the new owners switched out the Acme Lox to a cheaper brand but still charge the same ridiculous price for it. That being said the bialys and bagels are always good. Recently the bialys have been on the small side but I think they are training new bakers. I definitely wouldn't pass it up if you're in the neighborhood, nothing is like a warm bialy with butter. You can't go wrong
Hours say open until 8. Employees had put a bench in front of the door at 7. Inside cleaning up. No signage or explanation why they were closed a full hour early.
I came here on Thanksgiving morning and it was freezing outside! Their classical lox bagel and coffee was such a gift and it warmed my soul.
(Translated by Google) Good bagels  (Original) Bons bagels
My bagel place! Great bagels and spreads! The staff is super friendly and it’s fame has them popping out fresh bagels during peak hours. #SameTimeNextWeek
I’ve been going there for 40 years. It’s changed quite a bit, but the bialys are still amazing!
Always busy and food isn't cheap
Great stuff but NOT kosher!!
Mmmmmmmm
Very good bagels.  There is constantly baking going on due to the place being busy during peak hours,  and that is what makes it good. The high turnover almost guarantees fresh bagels.
Delicious bagels and cream cheese 😍😍😍  Staff is super friendly and attentive

Went earlier today. Food was very good. Service wasn't the best. Staff were quite rude and didnt seem to know they were doing. Asked for one type of bialy, they gave me another which was twice the price, and when i expressed how i was surprised at the price they were stand-offish. Tasted great but was all quite rude. 12$ is also a bit steep for a sandwich
Killer classic on everything.  Don't toast and enjoy the full chew
If you have never had Kossar, it is a MUST TRY if you are a resident or tourist. Genuine large NY bialy.
Nice bagels
First time trying bagels and the classic was amazing! Loved their services
Awesome bagels, fast service and reasonable prices. One of my favourite breakfast spots in Lower Manhattan.

Who is the pee brain who put tables and chairs in an already crammed space like Kossars....... what a mistake.... work on making your products better (bagles are hit or miss at best) and forgot about seating
Great choices and great taste for reasonable prices.

I’ve never had stale bagels from a bagel shop before. The person who was helping me forgot my order and I stood there for nearly 15 min trying to figure out why my order was taking so long while several people in line passed me and got their orders. I ordered an everything bagel with tofu cream cheese toasted. That’s it. I asked one of the people working there what’s going on, he looked at me confused. I don’t understand why he couldn’t he his coworker when she’s clearly backed up. By the time I got it the bagel was so hard to chew. I’m never coming back. What a waste of $4.
And absolutely must try. Made fresh in house. Fresh squeezed orange juice. The Classic is my favorite!
Delicious bagels, super fresh orange juice and awesome coffee - what else do you need for a good breakfast? It's a great place, many thanks and greetings from Germany!

Excellent sandwiches, wait times are pretty absurd considering how easy it is to make the sandwiches. The sandwiches are great because of the ingredients, not the way they're prepared. Their grilled chicken is fantastic, and the eggs and bagels + bialys are dope.
One of the better LES bagel spots even if their definition of “toasted” is on the light to not-at-all side.
Great bagels.
I ordered when the place was practically empty and they forgot my order. A stack of people then came in and all got served before me, so I waited 20+ mins for an average bagel.
Staff is always friendly but youre paying a lot of breakfast sandwich thats *alright*
Great bagels and Bialys.
It’s awite. I ordered a baily with cream and the service was good,  but nothing to write home about .
Nice little spot
Bialys the best when toasted.

The best bagels I've had in NYC. We visited twice. The first time there was a wait for fresh bialys so we went for normal bagels. Freshly made choice of different cream cheeses. The pastrami salmon is incredible and I have had nothing like it. I had the double onion cream cheese with pastrami salmon combo and it is so good!!! The next visit I had a bialy with the same combo and it was still amazing. Fresh orange juice is also available here. Unfortunately, the prices are high for a bagel, I would not consider this a cheap spot to grab breakfast. But a must visit at least once!!

Must have changed ownership. Not the bialy my mom used to go get when she was a kid. Recipe must have changed. Overly floured on the outside...and different flavors?!?!!?!? "Avocado Schmear" is proof that the hipsters are on their way to taking over the LES too.
Standard bagel and coffee but at a good price.
Great selection, high quality.  Nice little counter to sit and enjoy a bagel and coffee.
Best bagels and bialys

Staff was super friendly and helped me choose what to eat. I got French toast and it was the beeeeeeest I've ever had. Soooo sweet and perfect texture. My mom and aunt got a whole wheat bagel and everything bagel that were also a-maz-ing! We bought extra food to take home and got free bagels as well!!!!! Totally recommend!
Extraordinarily friendly staff, delicious fresh bagels and classic Jewish baked goods.
Yummy
Food and service is ok
A bagel store opens @6:00 am and @ 6:45am still no bagels very frustrating
Delicious!  Great bagels and friendly staff. They are fast and the bagels are fresh.
Amazing staff!
This was a stop on our walking tour. Very tasty!
Yummy and fast!
Bialy > bagel

What happened! I’ve been going to this place for years! I’ve even met the owner at a rock show a few years back and he’s an awesome dude.  The place completely changed. No more fresh bagels? The cashier was awful. So disappointed.
(Translated by Google) Originally, tasty .... highly recommended!  (Original) Ursprünglich, lecker .... sehr zu empfehlen !
Classic bagels and bialis. They have great options for bagels AND cream cheeses but also make a great sandwich. The line can get a little lengthy (not terrible though) so get there early if you can.
Great fresh bagels, many flavors.
This place is fantastic. So old school, great value and good selection. Best bagel I’ve ever had.
VERY upset!!! Kossar’s is now under new ownership and the bagels are now on par with a generic supermarket! Complete garbage! BRING BACK KOSSAR’S ORIGINAL RECIPE!!
I ate the dried tomatoes bialy. It's so good. I recommend this place. I wanted more bialy. The dried tomatoes bialy is their seasonal one.

One of the best bagel places I've tried in nyc. Literally made fresh right in front of you. Cream cheese bagel on everything bagel was perfectly fresh. Great assortment of bagels, cream cheese and topping.

While in NYC, I crept silently out of the hotel every morning while my gluten- & lactose-intolerant boyfriend was sleeping to get a bagel and cream cheese from this place. Back home, I dream of this place and wish my local bagel shops could come close.
Loooove the salmon bagel

(Translated by Google) Delicious bagels. Are manufactured on site. You should definitely have a look at flour when you are in Lower Manhattan.  (Original) Leckere Bagel. Werden vor Ort selbst hergestellt. Sollte man unbedingt Mehl rein schauen wenn man in Lower Manhattan ist.
Best bagels on Earth!!!  Been going there for the last 31 years
Great service and great bialys!

Not impressed. Bialys were not crusty enough. Ordered onion bialy with roasted garlic and onion cream cream. Cream cheese was tasty. They do have a large variety. Service is ok, but not particularly friendly. Coffee was good.
Pumpernickel everything! 😊
Best bialys and onion disc's for the last 100 years. After the renovation not as classy but still the best

Delicious bagels but they need to figure out how to keep the line shorter.  Help eople order ahead of time by phone or app, perhaps.  My favorite is the pumpernickel everything bagel.  Nom nom nom nom
Loved it

Ordered a dozen bagels and a dozen Bialys for my family, only for us to discover on opening that all of the Bialys had mold on them. 2 Day Air shipping and they send us this? Currently emailed asking for a refund for this. Only saving grace is the bagels were delicious and fresh.  EDIT: Moving this up to 3 stars as Evan was kind enough to respond and refund my purchase. Means alot.
Great first bialy! Got packed so come early
5 star bagels - bialys aren't that great.

(Translated by Google) Everything delicious !!! They speak Spanish and are very friendly. Good food at a good price  (Original) Todo delicioso!!! Hablan español y son muy amables. Comida buena y a buen precio
There was a line, but they were quick with order. Good overall
Pretty good but no bagel boss!

Really wanted to love this place as it's an institution.  Had a chance to try my first Bialy there which was good, and bought some to take home.  Don't leave them out on counter for more than 2 days or the onion/garlic filling starts to grow mold.   Ordered the Chocolate Babka which I love as well.  Tasty, but heavy as a brick, and not award winning.

Visited on October 4th 2017 So as I placed my order I always keep an eye on the person preparing my food, & to my surprise he changed his glove when finishing with the customer in front of me & never touched my food with his bare hands A+ . Very clean, Friendly staff, the guy behind the counter treated me like I was part of his family. zero complaints will definitely be coming back.
Overworked staff, so you get horrible service. Not the best bialy.
Great bagel, absolutely the best I have ever had.  Staff seemed overworked and tired though, could have been a bit more friendly.
Why do they say that they're open until 8 p.m. when actually there are no Bagels available starting 7 p.m.?
Big bagel sandwiches
Friendly efficient staff. Delicious bagels & babkas
Delicious
Amazing.
At least once a week for me. And they made sandwich now.
Went downhill. They used to give you a good amount of lox on your bagel, now just one thin little piece.
Great! Even better if you love yourself some cream cheese bc they do not skimp.
Best bagels in NYC. Fresh in the AM

Really good bagels (as opposed to the over-inflated tires that are called "bagels") are hard to find, even in NYC; but good bialy's are even harder to find.  Kossar's may be the only place in town that has genuine bialy's.
Delicious bagels, great value and the staff were always helpful. 5/5

I had been going since they reopened. Some of the best bagels in the area, but the service has really dropped off. Last straw for me was waiting on line only to have one of the servers skip me for someone they knew behind me. Why even have a line if the staff isn't going to respect it? I won't be going back.
Great bagels. The egg salad is a must.
Painfully slow Service. Very little staff on a saturday morning. Still in line.
Great food and service with a new look! New breaky menu with old time classics are worth the visit!

delicious delicious foods  AAA+ we give them  3B rating them BBB 1B Bagels 2B Babka 3B Bialys The best in New York City we also love the rugelach little chocolate croissants and fruit tart cookies they call it hamentashen cookies they make me a french toast out of there babka
Really, really tasty bagels, not too generous with the sandwich toppings, but we don't come here for the toppings ( or the coffee) now do we...
Best bagels in town
Disappointing

Excellent experience...the girl who took care of my order was happy to give me advice, and everyone working there was very warm, friendly, and accommodating in general. I was able to eat my meal at a bar stool in the window, which was nice since the weather wasn't good.
Very Yummy for a quick savory lunch! Skip it if you don't like onions and garlic ;-)
Best bialys in the city.  An institution to say the least.

Really. Not good. Service was terrible, we were a party of 3 ordering 3 sandwiches and they took our first 2 orders, made the sandwiches, helped 2 other customers with random things (buying water and an expired voucher), made a phone call to someone, then took our 3rd order. Despite reminding them twice we still had a 3rd order. Two bagels were cut horribly (I'm talking 90% of the bagel on the bottom, 10% on top). The ingredients were all over the place and cut terribly. My sandwich only had salmon on one side of it, my "shaved" celery was 1" cubes, and my tomato and onion slices were all random sizes, totally inconsistent. And, the bagel was chewy, tasted like it was from yesterday. Totally lame. Oh, and they were all out of the first 2 things I tried to order, but still uncharged me for the substitute.
Very nice and helpful staff. Good prices for good food. Would be nice to have more seating available.
Fantastic NYC bagesl. You can get them fresh if you go in the morning. Skip the coffee though.
Damn good bagel
Plain bagels are best!
Bagels are very delicious although pricey
amazing bagels. I love the chocolate babka. the babka french toast, on the other hand, is a bit too heavy.  service is fast and friendly.  Wish there were more tables and seats.
Great bialys - get them warm with cream cheese - it's a meal!!!
Busy,. Busy, Busy.  Everyone and their mother here.  Picking up my Onion Boards!!!!?
A NYC classic. Best bagels I've ever tasted with quality ingredients.
Simply delicious.  Crispy, flavourful and coming here again. Wow . Best bagels in NYC
Not kosher anymore.

New York bagels as they should be. Love the plain, everything and the egg (which comes as either plain or everything). Since H&H closed, have not had much success finding a replacement for a classic NY bagel, this comes the closest to it. For only a dollar a bagel, it is also a great price. Did not enjoy the bialy, but that might be a personal preference since I never have liked them in any place (their bialy felt the usual, both chewy and bland).
I have never had a bagel like this now, or since....so good. wish there was one around me.

Kossar's bakery has become no more than a sandwich store  I've been a Kossar's bialy fan for decades. Fresh, they need no butter or cream cheese - I could make a whole meal. Since moving out of the city, the Grand Street store has been a major stop on any drive in that direction.  I was terribly disappointed last Sunday to find a revised product, short on filling and lacking a crust with crunch. There is a new sign out front, suggesting a new owner maybe with a business degree but no appreciation of the fine art of a great bialy.
Bagels are huge, soft and delicious! And cheap!! Love!!!
Top bagel in NYC

Was in New York on a mini vacation I stopped here for some breakfast and a lovely kind and AMAZING man took care of me he was very polite and very pleasant told me good morning and asked how could he help I told him what I wanted he took care of my needs quick I paid and he then told me to have an amazing day I was in and out of there really good service I loved it I believe his name is (Mike he has tattoos) very nice individual 🏆 I'll make sure to pop in next time I'm in the city hopefully Kind Mike will be there to greet me again GREAT WORK ON CUSTOMER SERVICE & HIRING GUYS you will see me again ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
I had never had a "real" NYC bialy before (65 y.o.). We went after brunch at Katz's. Took a dozen onion back to DC on the Vamoose bus. Delicious. Like nothing I've ever had.
(Translated by Google) Delicious!  (Original) Super lecker!
I love this place. I have since I was a child.  But since they have re-opened, I really enjoy the food and the staff are GREAT. If you want really fresh and great food go to KOSSAR'S
Fresh bagels! Very attentive to customers aswell as polite especially Mike!

When all the brunch spot are full and you don't want to wait in line, come here! There is a small counter seating at the window, but head over to the park and enjoy the wonderful food and view. The service is quick and the food is delicious (the coffee not so much). Don't ever change Kossar's, your face lift got me a bit worry but the bagels and bialys are just as delicious as before!

Best bagels in NYC...been coming here for years. Since they have redone it however the service is some of the worst in the city. They are super slow everytime I come, and the people who work there are way less then friendly.  I know I'm not the only one who thinks this because I've heard other people fro. The neighborhood say the same...
Buck a bagel, and they're tasty.
Best bialys, bagles and babka. Period. No disputing it. Excellent customer service, beautiful store front. Have made the trip multiple times from Ohio and every time must stop for a babka.

We have been to the store twice in person once before the renovation, a just today. We are from Columbus and anytime someone comes this way we have them get us Babka. The new place is amazing!  The guys in there were so friendly and the best service experience I have had in New York City. Keep up the amazing food and awesome service!

Classic New York bagels with rich flavor, dense & moist crumb, and crisp crusts. Add the fresh dill cream cheese and the super reasonable prices, and I've never been happier with a schmear-topped dough bomb. So glad Kossar's is back!

Best place for bagels I've ever been.  They are super nice and the service is pretty fast.  There is always people there to get their stuff but that doesn't slow them down.  I really recommed it to anyone.
Stopped there today to pick up a dozen bialys for the weekend, waited on line, and when it was my turn, was told there would be a 40-minute wait for bialys...WHAT???

My first time in Kossars was great! I had an egg everything bagel with  whitefish lettuce,tomatoe and onion. Absolutley delicious. Although it was crowded I got asked for my order in a timely manner and the staff seemed to be very professional. The atmosphere was clean and bright. LOVE THE COLORS I will be back to eat there again soon.

This used to be my favorite spot in the LES, I would make trips down there! Now they don't have a kosher certificate and seem to only cater to tourists. They lost their old Jewish feel when they didn't get recertified, I don't care how many yenta sandwiches they make!!

(Translated by Google) I ate bagels here every morning on my trip to New York. I ate salmon at first but it's steamed. I only had cream cheese and jam. Price and taste are five points!  (Original) 뉴욕여행하며 매일 아침 여기서 베이글을 먹었어요. 처음엔 연어를 넣어 먹었는데 좀 짰어요. 크림치즈와 잼만 넣은 것이 만족도 높았습니다. 가격과 맛 모두 5점입니다!
Long cold walk there today.  Totally worth it.  Egg salad on egg bagel.  Like butter.

I  had looked forward to the re-opening of a renovated Kossar's store.  However, I am very disappointed with the bialys I took home today.  The garlic bialys contained no garlic or garlic taste, and they were heavy, whereas they used to be light in weight.   Please try to make them the way you did before the renovation/

If you measure success on a line down the block and people who can't actually get in and out.. Sure they are successful now with the reopen. If you want something like that good Ole fashioned sandwich or bialy without the hassle, no go. This place is now like the cronut people. Who cares
Love their bialys... Buy a dozen... Split them and freeze... Perfect weeks later!
Love their bialys — garlic's my favourite.
they taste the best when fresh out of the oven!

I have not been here since 1982, when I attended college in NY. I'm glad to see it's still there. I was introduced to bagels and bialys at Kossar's.  The bagel back then wasn't a thing yet.  Coffee shops  mostly offered donuts and buttered rolls.  Even Dunkin Donuts wasn't selling bagels then.  Maybe because I was a newbie then, but I still compare bagels to the ones I had in Kossar's over 30 years ago.  My son now attends university in NY and I told him about this place I went to for bagels. I didn't remember the name but remember the location. Thank you Google Maps for helping find it.  I see the same flour dusty tables and baskets are still there.  Next visit to see my son, I'll be stopping by for some old world original NY bagels and bialys.
lousy service.  it's sort of a dive, but the food is good.
Bialy grand Central, get a bag on the way to LaGuardia
I love the fresh baked Bialeys & the service was a warm friendly experience beginning with the helpful cashier I will be returning again.  I recommend this inviting establishment to all

We came into Kossar's Bially's today on Grand Street before an important meeting.  We weren't sure what to bring to the meeting as we were informed that our guests were Kosher.  We stepped in and were immediately greeted by a warm cashier who educated us on what Kosher means and served us with a smile.  Needless to say the meeting went very well and the Bially's were a success.  We will be back again soon.
Kossar's is a New York City institution and the last true home for a lost bread. Hands Down the Best Bialys in the world. The Bagels are true old world delicious too.

Bialy's are great but the young woman at the cash register has no customer service skills.  She was not very friendly and seemed annoyed that I  was asking her a question about their product.  She was more concerned with her knitting.
the best and the original
When we're downtown, we love to stop in here for a delicious bialy. The bagels are not to be missed either though!
.the bialys are really good,
Used to be so great; now an aspiring tourist attraction.  Bagels are good, but cost over a dollar a piece.
They do not toast their very tasty Bialys!
competes favorably with h&h and st. viateur. recommended.
